cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 370 mi (595 km) ESE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Accelerating northwest across the southern Gulf of Mexico and aiming for the central-western Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central to southwestern Louisiana coastline (near Cameron–Vermilion Bay)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for U.S. Gulf Coast as of this advisory
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect for U.S. Gulf Coast as of this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Western and central Gulf Coast from the upper Texas shoreline eastward through Louisiana and into Mississippi
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (and possibly brief hurricane-force gusts near the eyewall) are possible at Lake Charles beginning late Friday; cumulative 5-day chance of ≥34 kt winds is 46% and ≥50 kt is 22%.
weather_observation.storm_surge: A storm surge of at least 3–6 ft above normally dry ground is plausible in western Louisiana sounds and bays, including Calcasieu Lake, around the time of landfall.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy bands could deliver 4–8 inches of rain with locally higher totals, producing flash-flood potential over southwest Louisiana.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Tornado-producing outer rain bands, dangerous marine conditions, and prolonged port-operational interruptions due to debris and flooding.
